comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

comment.body:
Ok, the last filter update did the trick. The cookie notice is gone. Thanks
guys 👍👌

On Mon, Dec 11, 2023, 2:08 PM Liron Bainglass ***@***.***>
wrote:

> I tried turning off the destruction of third-party cookies option (the
> identical option for first-party cookies was already turned off), but it
> did not solve the issue. To be honest, I didn't expected it to work,
> because I already have Edge clear cookies on exit so it doesn't really
> matter.
>
> As for your first question ("Are Antivirus and AdGuard mutually exclusive
> from filtering each other?"), I don't really know what that means and,
> therefore, how to check for that. Sorry.
>
> On Mon, Dec 11, 2023, 9:02 AM jellizaveta ***@***.***>
> wrote:
>
>> Are Antivirus and AdGuard mutually exclusive from filtering each other?
>> Could you try also disabling the stealth mode options concerning cookies
>> and test the page without it?
>>
>> —
>> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
>> <https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/168052#issuecomment-1850255410>,
>> or unsubscribe
>> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/ASWTGTG76J55PPMW6L76RRTYI4N63AVCNFSM6AAAAABAMK24JSVHI2DSMVQWIX3LMV43OSLTON2WKQ3PNVWWK3TUHMYTQNJQGI2TKNBRGA>
>> .

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

Website from the link looks different than on the screenshot.
I have checked out a link from the related issue - https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/165914#issuecomment-1806241591 and I couldn't reproduce it.
Please update filters and check with a DNS filtering disabled (it might cause detection and in this case it's rather not easy to fix).

By the way, this website often change adblock detection and detection may also depends on location, so it may stop working anytime soon.
